e: - Hello, Vogue.
I'm Anya Taylor-Joy, and this is my life in looks so far.
k: 저는 아냐 테일러조이입니다. 지금까지 제 인생에 대한 스타일을 보여드렸습니다.

e: [chill jazzy music]
I'm curious, I wanna know.
I'm like, "What do you have in here?"
Oh my God!
So this is Thomasin in "The Witch."
This was my first real film role.
k: 이게 제가 맡은 첫 번째 영화 역할이었어요.

e: I loved that costume so much.
It's a soft corset,
which if you're getting into corsetry,
was a very good way to go.
And what you can't see underneath this
k: 그리고 이 아래에 보이지 않는 건 내 머리카락 전체를 묶어주는

e: is that I have one long hair ribbon
that's tying all of my hair together.
And I fell so in love with this character,
k: 그리고 저는 이 캐릭터에 완전히 반해버렸고,

e: and I didn't realize that characters were real for me
because this was my first job.
k: 이게 제 첫 직업이었기 때문에 캐릭터가 제게 실제적이라는 걸 깨닫지 못했습니다.

e: So when the job finished,
I was really mourning her,
and I kept her hair ribbons in my bag for a whole year.
k: 그녀의 머리 리본을 1년 내내 내 가방에 넣어 두었습니다.

e: And then we did re-shoots,
and they were like, "Ah, we don't have the hair ribbon."
And I was like, "I got it."
This is the first time that I went to the Met Gala.
k: 메트 갈라에 간 건 이번이 처음이에요. 제가

e: That is the only time that I've been to the Met Gala.
k: 메트 갈라에 간 건 이번이 처음이에요.

e: I've always been working when it's happening.
k: 저는 항상 그 일이 일어날 때 일하고 있었습니다.

e: I loved this dress so much, it was so heavy.
k: 이 드레스는 너무 무거워서 정말 좋았어요.

e: I was really freaked out because I didn't know anybody.
k: 저는 아는 사람이 아무도 없어서 정말 당황했습니다.

e: And I think that situation in and of itself
is very like, "Ah!"
But the dress made me feel great.
k: 하지만 그 드레스를 입으니 기분이 좋아졌어요.

e: And I don't know if you can see,
k: 그리고 여러분이 볼 수 있을지 모르겠지만,

e: but I'm wearing a necklace
that has like a bunch of little baby heads all over it.
k: 아기 머리가 잔뜩 달린 목걸이를 하고 있어요.

e: And that was my favorite part.
k: 그리고 그것이 제가 가장 좋아하는 부분이었습니다.

e: But at the end of the night, I got to,
I was at the top of the stairs
and was kind of just trying
to like honestly figure out how I was going to get home.
k: 솔직히 집에 어떻게 갈지 고민하고 있었습니다.

e: I hadn't thought that far ahead,
and I was like, "Ah, this is gonna be madness."
And Hailee Steinfeld walked past me,
k: 그리고 헤일리 스타인펠드가 내 옆을 지나갔는데,

e: and she had all of these like long trains,
and they enveloped me and almost toppled me to my death.
But then Jimmy Fallon saved me.
So that's a very normal story, I think.
Yeah!
Oh, these make me so happy.
This is Johnny Flynn and myself,
k: 이 사진은 조니 플린과 저입니다. 영화 "엠마"를 촬영하기 위해

e: shot by Autumn de Wilde for our movie, "Emma."
Look at my shoes!
So like the best thing about all of these costumes
k: 그래서 이 모든 의상의 가장 좋은 점은 수시간에 걸쳐

e: is they were made on my body
from like hours and hours of fittings.
And Alexandra Byrne, our costume designer,
k: 그리고 우리의 의상 디자이너인 알렉산드라 번은

e: who like I want to be when I grow up, she's so cool,
k: 제가 자라서 되고 싶은 사람이에요. 그녀는 정말 멋진 사람이고,

e: we got to spend so much time together.
And it felt like such an integral part of the character.
k: 그리고 그것은 캐릭터의 필수적인 부분처럼 느껴졌습니다.

e: And the thing with Emma is she's always performing.
k: 그리고 에마의 장점은 그녀가 항상 공연을 한다는 것입니다.

e: Her wardrobe is very performative.
And so each one of the looks was like a true look,
from the earrings, to the necklace,
to the shoes, to the reticule.
k: 신발, 레티큘까지 각각의 룩이 진짜 룩 같았어요.

e: That's a fun word, reticule.
Yeah, it was great.
I forgot that, yeah.
I was nominated for a Golden Globe for this.
k: 저는 이 작품으로 골든글로브상 후보에 올랐습니다.

e: It was a weird time
because my whole experience of award shows
all took place over Zoom.
And I got nominated
for "Emma" and "Queen's Gambit," I think.
And it was just so surreal and exciting
and, yeah, really thrilling.
2020 was a big, yeah, here we go.
Baby Beth, "Queen's Gambit."
She is about to get her first period.
k: 그녀는 곧 첫 생리를 맞이할 예정이다.

e: It's a big day for her.
This was really fun
k: 이 게임은 정말 재미있었습니다. 제가 정말 좋아하는 캐릭터와

e: because I got to spend so much time with this character
that I loved so much,
and I got to play her
through so many different eras of her life.
k: 의 인생의 여러 시대를 연기할 수 있었기 때문입니다.

e: And I remember having like a real fondness
for her at this age.
k: 이 나이에 그녀에 대한 진정한 애정을 느꼈던 걸 기억합니다.

e: She kind of walks a little dumpy,
she's like a bit unsure of herself.
k: 자신에 대해 약간 자신감이 없는 것 같아요.

e: I had never played chess,
k: 저는 체스를 한 번도 두어 본 적이 없었고, 첫날에 나타났을 때

e: and it was crazy because we showed up my first day,
and they gave me like this bible of all the chess moves
k: 그들은 쇼에서 펼칠 모든 체스 움직임과

e: that we were going to do in the show,
all of the chess games,
k: 모든 체스 게임이 적힌 성경 같은 책을 주었는데,

e: and they were all based off of historical games.
k: 모두 역사적인 게임을 바탕으로 한 것이었어요.

e: And I like went home,
I was a good student, I learned a bunch of them.
k: 좋은 학생이 되었고, 많은 것을 배웠습니다.

e: Our first day was the Mexico tournament series,
and they changed a move,
and I was like, "No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no."
k: 저는 "아니, 아니, 아니, 아니, 아니, 아니, 아니, 아니, 아니"

e: This is how this is gonna work.
k: 라고 생각했어요. 이렇게 하면 될 것 같아요.

e: You're gonna show me the moves five minutes beforehand,
I'm gonna execute it, and then I'm gonna bin that
and throw another one in.
And it worked.
I love her final white queen look
k: 저는 그녀의 마지막 화이트 퀸 룩을 좋아합니다.

e: because I think that's when she was feeling herself.
k: 왜냐하면 그녀가 자신을 느꼈을 때였기 때문이라고 생각하기 때문입니다.

e: She was like, "Yeah, I'm okay."
[Anya laughs]
There are so many of the shoes
that I actually really enjoyed.
k: 제가 정말 좋아하는 신발이 정말 많아요.

e: I really love a kitten heel.
I got to keep a bunch.
Another wonderful costume designer, Gabriele Binder,
k: 또 다른 훌륭한 의상 디자이너인 가브리엘 빈더는

e: she was so tender towards me
because all of my characters are important to me,
but Beth was somebody
that I knew from the second I read her,
k: 처음 그녀를 읽었을 때부터 알고 있는 사람이었고,

e: and I was like, "Oh, okay, this is..."
She was the first character
that I had to give a lot of myself to
in order to be able to make her real.
And Gabriele was very cognizant of that
k: 그리고 가브리엘은 그 점을 잘 알고 있었고

e: and really tried all of the clothes on me.
And if my body rejected it,
k: 그리고 만약 내 몸이 그것을 거부한다면,

e: we would take them away.
So at the end of the show,
she said, "This is your wardrobe, so you can keep it."
k: 그녀는 "이건 네 옷장이야. 네가 가져가도 돼."라고 말했어요.

e: The coolest thing about "Queen's Gambit"
was I'd gone back to work,
I was working on "The Northman" at the time,
and the only reason that I realized it was doing well
k: 잘 되고 있다는 걸 깨달은 유일한 이유는

e: was because members of the crew would come up to me
and be like, "Hey, I saw your show.
"You were really great in it."
And I was like, "Okay."
And then it was just more and more and more people.
So it was a gentle experience, I would say, until it wasn't.
k: 그래서 그냥 편안한 경험이라고 생각했는데, 결국엔 그렇지 않게 됐죠.

e: [Anya laughs] Okay.
Ah, I love this dress so much!
This is Dior at the Emmy's.
This was a crazy time in my life.
I was shooting "The Menu,"
doing awardsy stuff for "Queen's Gambit,"
and promoting "Last Night in Soho" all at the same time.
And I think we were on night shoots for "The Menu."
So it was really like a...
[Anya drum rolls]
I had a dream about this dress,
and I wrote to Maria Grazia,
and I was like, "I've just had this image,
"and I really, you know,
"would love it if it could come true."
And she made it come true.
I felt so good in this.
The back was really, really low.
I can't remember what movie the reference was from,
k: 무슨 영화에서 따온 건지 기억은 안 나는데 , 등에

e: but I was wearing Tiffany diamonds on the back.
And I felt good.
2021, another, ah, I love a cape.
I love these silhouettes.
Look at the shoe.
This is also Dior.
This was Golden Globes.
Again, it was still COVID,
so there was no award ceremony in person.
It was all on a computer.
And my friends had flown over
and asked me how I wanted to celebrate.
And I said I really wanted vegan fried chicken
k: 비건 프라이드 치킨을 먹고 싶다고 했고

e: and I wanted to have a sleepover.
And then I won,
and then we did that and it was great.
Okay.
This is Sandie wearing similar boots
from "Last Night in Soho."
k: "소호에서의 마지막 밤"에 나온 비슷한 부츠를 신은 샌디예요.

e: This was very late at night.
We basically became nocturnal for months,
and it was hilarious because we were shooting in real Soho,
k: 진짜 소호에서 촬영을 했기 때문에 정말 웃겼어요.

e: and I would see my friends that were out partying,
and they were like, "Why do you look like that?"
And I was like, "I am working."
[Anya laughs]
I knew she sang, but I think I was a bit anxious about it,
k: 그녀가 노래하는 건 알았지만, 좀 불안했던 것 같아요. 저는

e: and the way that I deal with my anxiety
is by putting it off,
which is like probably not the intelligent way of doing it.
And so it just came to the day,
and I was like, "Ah, okay, I'm gonna do my best."
The dancing, we did have rehearsals,
and that was so much fun.
Like me and Matt Smith dancing together
k: 맷 스미스랑 몇 시간씩 같이 춤을 췄는데

e: for hours on end, it was fab.
What year are we in now?
This is "The Menu" premiere.
I'm wearing Alexander McQueen.
"The Menu" is a satirical horror movie
in which a group of guests
arrive at a Michelin star restaurant
where the chef has other ideas
about what is on the menu that evening.
k: 그날 저녁 메뉴에 대해 다른 생각을 하는 내용이에요.

e: Did that make any sense? [Anya laughs]
Okay.
2024, I am wearing Dior
k: 2024년, 저는 디올 옷을 입고 있어요. 런던에서 열린

e: at the "Dune: Part Two" premiere in London.
It was the hardest secret I think I've ever had to keep.
k: 제 생각에 지금까지 지켜야 했던 비밀 중 가장 어려웠던 비밀이었어요.

e: But I'll really, you know, give props to Denis on this one.
k: 하지만 이번 작품은 정말, 데니스에게 경의를 표하고 싶어요.

e: He is the most wonderful human being and talented creator,
k: 그는 정말 멋진 사람이자 재능 있는 창작자예요. 팬들을 위해 이 비밀을 지켜줄 거라는

e: and he had so much faith and hope
that we were gonna keep this secret for the fans
that it just really made you wanna go, "Shh."
So I told my mom and I told my husband.
That was it.
It was just so exciting.
All the cast were so kind to me.
It was fabulous.
What a great way to be like, "Welcome to the family."
k: "가족이 된 걸 환영해"라고 인사하는 멋진 방법이었어요.

e: I'm like dressed like an egg.
k: 마치 계란 옷을 입은 것 같았어요.

e: Like, "Hi, how's it going?" [Anya laughs]
Hee-hee!
This is the "Furiosa" premiere in Australia, in Sydney.
k: 여기는 호주 시드니에서 열린 "퓨리오사" 프리미어 시사회예요 .

e: This is archival Paco Rabanne.
And it, ugh, it was so good.
I couldn't sit down, but that was fine.
I will like give that up any day to wear this.
k: 이 머리 장식을 쓰려면 언제든 포기하고 싶을 정도예요.

e: That headpiece was incredible.
It was very heavy.
I definitely had like insane divots in my head.
k: 정말 미칠 지경이었어요. 머릿속에 움푹 들어간 곳이 있어요.

e: Fun fact, I tend to surf to most of my premieres.
k: 재밌는 건, 저는 시사회에 갈 때 대부분 서핑을 하는 편이에요.

e: We get a sprinter van,
and I am standing up in the middle of the aisles,
and I've now like turned that into a fun game for myself.
k: 이제 제 나름대로 재밌는 게임처럼 만들었어요.

e: I would like to like not hold onto anything
and just exclusively surf.
I also don't really work out,
so that's like a really good thigh exercise,
and it gives me a place to put my anxiety.
So, yeah, I surf.
This is arriving in Cannes.
I am wearing Atlein, and the hat is Jacquemus.
k: 아틀레인(Atlein) 옷을 입고 있고, 모자는 자크뮈스(Jacquemus) 제품이에요.

e: I'm not usually very well organized.
k: 저는 평소에 정리를 잘 안 하는 편이에요.

e: I'm very good at onset environments.
My brain works in that way.
k: 하죠. 제 뇌는 그런 식으로 돌아가죠.

e: But, for myself, I'm like quite a messy individual.
And for this, I just got like,
I don't know, a message from beyond
that was like, "You should change now."
So I wore something different on the plane,
and then I went into the bathroom and came out,
and everyone was like, "Okay, like, let's go."
Very glad I did wear that hat though.
k: 더라고요. 아주 그 모자를 써서 다행이었어요.

e: There was a lot of people outside,
and it was kind of like a good buffer actually.
I'm a sucker for headpieces.
I really love the '20's,
and I love old Hollywood as well.
And I just feel like there's something
about the theatricality of it
that makes me feel more in my body in these situations.
k: 이런 상황에서 제 몸을 더 잘 느낄 수 있게 해주는 것 같아요.

e: I feel like if I can make something into art,
k: 뭔가를 예술로 만들 수 있다면 더

e: then I have an easier time with it.
k: 쉽게 표현할 수 있을 것 같아요.

e: So, yeah, headpieces, they help.
Ah-ha-ha-ha-ha, yeah.
This is the Golden Globes.
I am wearing archival Dior.
I felt so good.
I felt so comfortable.
There's something about this specific silk, it's like heavy.
k: 이 특별한 실크는 뭔가 묵직한 느낌이 들어요.

e: If I was a fabric,
I would like to believe that I am this fabric.
I feel like I could wear it forever.
k: 영원히 쓰고 다닐 수 있을 것 같아요.

e: I still get so excited
that I get to watch all of these movies before they're out.
k: 개봉 전에 이 모든 영화를 볼 수 있다는 사실에 너무 신나요.

e: I feel like that's my version of like making it,
that and reading books that aren't published.
k: 출판되지 않은 책을 읽는 것 같은 느낌이 들어요.

e: I just feel thrilled.
So, yeah, I definitely do a lot of watching over Christmas.
k: 그래서, 네, 크리스마스에는 정말 많이 챙겨요.

e: This necklace has an absurd amount of carats.
I feel like I'm told about it,
and then I try my best to forget
k: 잊어버리려고 애쓰는 것 같아요. 그러다 보면

e: because then I'm like,
Take it back, take it back, take it back.
k: 돌려줘, 돌려줘, 돌려줘 하는 생각이 들거든요.

e: I didn't realize that people didn't wear opals.
k: 사람들이 오팔을 안 끼는 줄은 몰랐어요.

e: I just thought they were beautiful.
And I like the fact that they changed
k: 그리고 빛에 따라 색이 변하는 게 마음에 들어요

e: depending on the light.
Also, a friend of mine like sent me,
I'm not on TikTok, TikTok is bad for me,
k: 저는 틱톡을 안 해요. 틱톡은 저한테 안 좋은데,

e: but a friend of mine sent me a TikTok
that basically talked about
like how I don't give a fuck about a color wave
or like a color analysis thing.
k: 나 컬러 분석 같은 건 전혀 신경 안 쓴다는 얘기를 들었어요.

e: And looking at this like,
yeah, I would agree with you.
I don't think I give a fuck about the color analysis.
k: 신경 안 쓰는 것 같아요. 라고 생각했죠.

e: [Anya laughs]
This was the most fun day.
It was very cold, but we did not care.
k: 날씨가 엄청 추웠지만, 신경 안 썼어요.

e: I have a really wonderful relationship
with Seb, the photographer.
He knows me and my husband really well,
and so it just felt easy.
I had a really good soundtrack on,
and, yeah, it was a really beautiful day.
My grandmother is a religious reader,
and she lives in Zaragoza, it's from Barcelona,
and so it's just really, really, like I feel proud.
[chill jazzy music]
Thank you for watching.
Love to you all.
This was really fun.
And, yeah, I'm excited to see where this goes next.
k: 그리고 네, 다음 이야기가 어떻게 전개될지 정말 기대돼요.

e: [chill jazzy music]
